page.title: 07The "balloon stone".
page.content: At the corner of Huggins Lane and Parsonage Lane there is a small, squat granite stone etched with the following inscription: {NEAR THIS SPOT AT 3.30 IN THE {AFTERNOON OF SEPTEMBER 15th 1784, {VINCENZO LUNARDI MADE HIS 1st LANDING {WHILST ON HIS PIONEER FLIGHT IN THE {ENGLISH ATMOSPHERE. {HAVING HANDED OUT A CAT AND A DOG, THE {PARTNERS OF HIS FLIGHT FROM LONDON, HE {RE-ASCENDED AND CONTINUED NORTH {EASTWARD.} This was the first aerial voyage in England.The "balloon stone"was only erected in the last twenty years-but is it in the right place? Detailed investigation of eye-witness accounts fix the landing at a point over three miles south east,near the boundary of the Hatfield and Northaw Parishes.
